## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm trying to get some information about my wallet using Verus. How can I get information about my wallet's balances, including immature and staking balances?

**AI Assistant:**
You can get information about your wallet's balances, including immature and staking balances, by running the command `verus getwalletinfo`. That should give you the info you need!

**User:**
Cool, thanks! Now I need to send some VRSC coins to another address. How can I do that using the command line?

**AI Assistant:**
No problem! You can send VRSC coins from your Verus wallet to another VRSC address by running the command `verus sendtoaddress "<VRSC_address>" <AMOUNT> "<Some comments here>"`. Just replace `<VRSC_address>` with the actual address you want to send to, `<AMOUNT>` with the amount of VRSC you want to send, and `<Some comments here>` with any comments you want to add.

**User:**
Got it! What if I want to list the latest VRSC transactions?

**AI Assistant:**
Easy one! You can list the latest VRSC transactions by running the command `verus listtransactions`. That should give you a list of your recent transactions.

**User:**
Okay, now I need to shield some reward coins from all public addresses. How do I do that?

**AI Assistant:**
You can shield reward coins from all public addresses by running the command `verus z_shieldcoinbase "*" "<z-ADDRESS>"`. Just replace `<z-ADDRESS>` with the z-address you want to shield the coins to.

**User:**
What if I need to transfer VRSX coins from any address type (P-, i-, or z-address) to any other address type?

**AI Assistant:**
You can transfer VRSX coins from any address type (P-, i-, or z-address) to any other address type by running the command `verus z_sendmany "<z-, i- or P-ADDRESS>" '[{"amount":<X>, "address":"<Z-, i- or P-ADDRESS>"}]'`. Just replace `<z-, i- or P-ADDRESS>` with the address you're sending from, `<X>` with the amount you want to send, and `<Z-, i- or P-ADDRESS>` with the address you're sending to.

**User:**
Finally, how can I check the operation status of a `z_sendmany` or `z_shieldcoinbase` command?

**AI Assistant:**
You can check the operation status of a `z_sendmany` or `z_shieldcoinbase` command by running the command `verus z_getoperationstatus`. That should give you the status of your operation.
AI Assistant
N/A
How can I get information about my wallet's balances, including immature and staking balances, using Verus?
You can get information about your wallet's balances, including immature and staking balances, by running the command `verus getwalletinfo`.

get info about your wallet, (immature & staking) balances:
`verus getwalletinfo`

Sending VRSC coins from your verus wallet to and another VRSC address (only public address in this case, seperate command for z-addresses I think):
`verus sendtoaddress "<VRSC_address>" <AMOUNT> "<Some comments here>"`

Listing the latest VRSC transactions:
`verus listtransactions`

Shield reward coins from all public addresses:
`verus z_shieldcoinbase "*" "<z-ADDRESS>"`

Transfer X VRSX from any (P-, i- and z-) address to any (P-, i- and z-) address:
`verus z_sendmany "<z-, i- or P-ADDRESS>" '[{"amount":<X>, "address":"<Z-, i- or P-ADDRESS>"}]'`

Check the Operation Status of your z_sendmany command (or z_shieldconbase):
`verus z_getoperationstatus`

Disclaimer: Always read up before using a verus-cli command, more info on each command can be found using the following:
`verus help`

Added by @Crupti, @Oliver Westbrook and Oink.vrsc@
note: last revision date 2020-05-09.
